font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">A true yogi knows how\nto stimulate the vagus nerve by yoga and breathing methods. &nbsp;It have been recorded very often by ECG and\nKorotkoff sounds , that Indian yogis could stop breathing and heart beat at\nwill, since ancient days.&nbsp;&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Stimulating\nthe vagus nerve causes a reduction of blood pressure and heart rate by\ntriggering the release of what \"Vagusstoff\" (German for: \"Vagus\nSubstance\"). &nbsp;This was later named\nas acetylcholine and became the first neurotransmitter identified by\nscientists.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">It was an ancient\npractice to stimulate the vagus nerve with 108 marma point of Kalarai and\nAyurveda too. &nbsp;Ancient Indians knew the\ngut brain connection. &nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; line-height: 150%;\">Almost of the Serotonin\nis generated in the human gut and NOT in the brain. &nbsp;Till today whenever I had a headache ( say\nonce in 6 months ) I have always taken a stomach pacifier like Alka Seltzer\neffervescent tablets. &nbsp;It worked for me\nwithin 180 seconds.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Serotonin is a magical\nsubstance that travels from the digestive tract to the pineal gland , which\ngives you the feel good factor, helps you to learn, fall asleep etc. &nbsp;Some cells even use serotonin as a growth\nfactor, and it plays a role in wound healing as well.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The Enteric Nervous\nSystem is involved predominantly with food digestion, waste elimination and\nsending full/hungry signals to the brain. &nbsp;More than 90% of the nerve fibers of the ENS\nrun one way, from the stomach area, through the vagus nerve and up into the\nbrain.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">When an athlete is said\nto be \u2018in the zone\u2019 and performing at near perfect levels, it is because they\nare practically and literally almost unconscious and functioning entirely\nthrough their ENS.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; line-height: 150%;\"><b><span style=\"color: blue; font-size: large;\">GUT FEELING AND\nINTUITION VADAKAYIL</span></b><span style=\"font-size: small;\"><o:p></o:p></span></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: 'Times New Roman', serif; line-height: 150%;\"><b><span style=\"color: blue; font-size: large;\"><br /></span></b></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">and<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: 'Times New Roman', serif; line-height: 150%;\"><b><span style=\"color: blue; font-size: large;\">IN THE ZONE VADAKAYIL</span></b><span style=\"font-size: small;\"><o:p></o:p></span></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br />\n<span style=\"font-family: 'Times New Roman', serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">The Vagus nerve is the\nlongest cranial nerve in the human body . It is a mixed cranial nerve\ncontaining motor and approximately 80% sensory fibers and has the widest\ndistribution in the body.</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The Vagus nerve also, is\nthe only nerve in the body that is present through each one of the 7 Chakras-\nfrom Crown Chakra through to the Root Chakra. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"http://1.bp.blogspot.com/-yoX6LmUMoec/UgvZ0EyUayI/AAAAAAAAlKs/8WxH7jI_daQ/s1600/chakra-details.com_.jpgtru5u.jpg\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">This nerve is\nresponsible among many things for monitoring and initiating digestive\nprocesses, and modulating inflammation.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The Vagus nerve is the\nmain line of communication between the brain and the energy-producing digestive\ntract. &nbsp;It also relays information to the\nbrain from what is known as the Enteric Nervous System (ENS). &nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The ENS is our \"second brain\"\ncontrolling the digestive process; it is made up of more than 500 million\nneurons that surround the digestive tract. &nbsp;It is called a second brain because it can\nfunction independently from the brain if the Vagus nerve is severed.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"http://3.bp.blogspot.com/-DHMaDuiWO60/UgvZ-m3PSlI/AAAAAAAAlK0/a5q3uTi3zlo/s1600/vagus.jpg\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" height=\"375\" src=\"http://3.bp.blogspot.com/-DHMaDuiWO60/UgvZ-m3PSlI/AAAAAAAAlK0/a5q3uTi3zlo/s400/vagus.jpg\" width=\"400\" /></a></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Defects in the normal\nfunctioning of Vagus nerve impairs the normal control mechanisms that modulate\nthe gastric acid secretion. Excessive secretion of peptic acid leads to\nulceration, dyspepsia and gastro-esophageal reflux disease.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Vagus nerve is responsible\nfor keeping the digestive tract in working order, contracting the muscles of\nthe stomach and intestines to help process food, and sending back information\nabout what is being digested and what the body is getting out of it. &nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">An underactive vagus nerve can lead to a\ncondition called gasteroparesis. This condition leads to nausea, heartburn,\nstomach pains, spasms in the stomach and weight loss due to the digestive\nsystem having too little of the chemicals it needs to break down food.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"http://1.bp.blogspot.com/-KNlMt5qSwTc/UgvaI1PkbrI/AAAAAAAAlK8/mwtzRDUcK-8/s1600/%D0%92%D0%B0%D0%B3%D1%83%D1%81-3%D0%B0.gif\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Vagus nerve acts as the\nmind-body connection, and it is the cabling behind your heart\u2019s emotions and\ngut instincts.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Your gut has both good\nbacteria and bad bacteria. &nbsp;The human\nbody carries about 100 trillion microorganisms in its intestines, a number ten\ntimes greater than the total number of human cells in the body.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Bacteria make up most\nof the flora in the colon and up to 60% of the dry mass of feces.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">You can feed the\nprobiotics (good bacteria) in your gut with prebiotic foods.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Prebiotics are the\nnutrients that allow the probiotics to thrive inside your intestine.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; We eat fermented foods like Idli, Dosa , curd chutney\netc. Having plain yoghurt , or lassi after lunch and dinner is commonplace.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; Fructose does not appropriately\nstimulate insulin, which in turn does not suppress ghrelin (the \"hunger\nhormone\") and doesn't stimulate leptin (the \"satiety hormone\"),\nwhich together result in your eating more and developing insulin resistance. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Western diets are filled\nwith sweets and sugars, processed foods, and fast foods. These foods damage and\ninflame the intestinal walls, promoting overgrowth of bad bacteria and yeasts and\nbreakdown of the intestinal barrier that leads to leaky gut..<o:p></o:p></span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"http://3.bp.blogspot.com/-i6doxBxC2SE/Ug0LXpiKQYI/AAAAAAAAlM8/m0NSYw82gPg/s1600/download.jpgeqva.jpg\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" height=\"256\" src=\"http://3.bp.blogspot.com/-i6doxBxC2SE/Ug0LXpiKQYI/AAAAAAAAlM8/m0NSYw82gPg/s400/download.jpgeqva.jpg\" width=\"400\" /></a></div>\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">If you have an\ninfection it is important to know whether it is caused by bacteria or a virus.\nMost upper respiratory tract infections, such as the common cold and sore\nthroats are generally caused by viruses - antibiotics do not work against these\nviruses. A broad-spectrum antibiotic can be used to treat a wide range of infections.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">A narrow-spectrum antibiotic is only effective against a few types of bacteria.\nThere are antibiotics that attack aerobic bacteria, while others work against\nanaerobic bacteria. Aerobic bacteria need oxygen, while anaerobic bacteria\ndon't. Antibiotics may be given beforehand, to prevent infection, as might be\nthe case before surgery. This is called 'prophylactic' use of antibiotics.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">If you do not complete\nthe full antibiotic course, there is a higher chance the bacteria may become\nresistant to future treatments - because the ones that survive when you did not\ncomplete the course have had some exposure to the antibiotic and may\nconsequently have built up a resistance to it. Even if you are feeling better,\nyou still need to complete the course.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">A kilo of body fat is K\n9000 calories. &nbsp;You need to run more than\n105 kilometers to get rid of this. &nbsp;Yes,\nexercise burns calories, but the amount is often trivial and with so much of\neffort. Eating sensibly reduces weight and also prevents major &nbsp;diseases.. &nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">If you eat too much refined food infused with\nfats and GM oils , calories will flood your body. &nbsp;Usually, a hormone called insulin would help\nyour cells absorb these calories for use. But the sheer overabundance of energy\nin this case overwhelms your cells. They stop responding to insulin. To\ncompensate, your pancreas begins cranking out more insulin. When the pancreas\nfinally collapses from exhaustion, you have diabetes.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; The goal is\nto kill potentially bad bacteria that may have found its way into the milk\nsupply. The problem with pasteurization is that it kills all the beneficial\nbacteria we call probiotics as well as damaging the vitamins, minerals and\ndenaturing the proteins leading to some of our health issues.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The proteins actually\nget warped, making them look like invaders to our immune system, causing our\nbodies to mount an attack in the form of an allergic reaction.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">On ships we buy long\nlife UHT milk in cartons , like what you get in FDI stores.\nUltra-pasteurization heats the milk to 280\u00ba for only a few seconds and it kills\nall bacteria good and bad. font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><i>Music was composed by\nLaxmikant Pyarelal.</i><o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n</div>\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"http://3.bp.blogspot.com/-V1lxONgHf4U/Uge-YNi9iII/AAAAAAAAlIs/_WaBxWFSG88/s1600/heart_touching40.jpg\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" src=\"http://3.bp.blogspot.com/-V1lxONgHf4U/Uge-YNi9iII/AAAAAAAAlIs/_WaBxWFSG88/s640/heart_touching40.jpg\" height=\"640\" width=\"464\" /></a></div>\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: left;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Reshma said once in an\ninterview, \"I was born in a family of saudagars in Rajasthan in a small\nsettlement called Bikaner. I don't know the year I was born but I was told that\nI was brought to Pakistan when I was a few months old in 1947. My family would\ntake camels from Bikaner and sell them in other areas, and bring back goats and\ncows from elsewhere to sell at home. I belong to a huge clan of gypsies. We\nwere forever travelling around. Though a lot of us have now settled and taken\nup permanent residences in Lahore and Karachi, whenever we feel restless we\npack our bags and move on.\"<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both;\">\n</div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">In January 2006 she was\none of the passengers on the inaugural Lahore-Amritsar bus, the first such\nservice linking both parts of the Punjab since 1947. The bus had 26 passengers\nin total of whom 15 were Pakistani officials, and Reshma had booked seven seats\nfor herself and her family.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: left;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: left;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: left;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; Sudarshan subsequently\nwrote a paper expressing his ideas and sent a preprint to Glauber.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Glauber informed\nSudarshan of similar results and asked to be acknowledged in the latter\u2019s\npaper, while criticizing Sudarshan in his own paper.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">\u201cGlauber criticized\nSudarshan\u2019s representation, but his own was unable to generate any of the\ntypical quantum optics phenomena, hence he introduces what he calls a\nP-representation, which was Sudarshan\u2019s representation by another name,\u201d wrote\na physicist . \u201cThis representation, which had at first been scorned by Glauber,\nlater becomes known as the Glauber-Sudarshan representation.\u201d<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"http://1.bp.blogspot.com/-GHNJvkYo26c/UgMSaqkkO6I/AAAAAAAAlIQ/3KLM0Lf-PhY/s1600/000.pnggreu76.png\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" height=\"640\" src=\"https://1.bp.blogspot.com/-GHNJvkYo26c/UgMSaqkkO6I/AAAAAAAAlIQ/3KLM0Lf-PhY/s640/000.pnggreu76.png\" width=\"420\" /></a></div>\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">After Sudarshan was\ndenied a Nobel Prize for Physics in 2005, a group of scientists submitted a\npetition to the Swedish Nobel Academy, as follows&nbsp; \u201cIt is difficult to understand how the work\nfor which Glauber is cited could be honoured in isolation from Sudarshan\u2019s\npublished discoveries and formulations, which were initially criticized and\nsubsequently adopted by Glauber.\u201d<o:p></o:p></span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Everybody knows that\nthe 2005 Nobel prize for Physics was awarded for Sudarshan\u2019s work, but he was\nnot the one to get it. &nbsp;Each one of the discoveries that the Nobel was given for\nwere based on Sudarshan\u2019s research alone.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Sudarshan currently\nholds the record of the most nominated Nobel Prize candidate alive for Science, &nbsp;who never received it.</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">&nbsp; If we was a Jew would this happen?&nbsp;</span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Our stupid media cried\nhoarse to give Bharat Ratna to Sachin Tendulkar. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">SQUEAK SQUEAK&nbsp; AAILA &nbsp;AAIGA. &nbsp;&nbsp;<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Nine and a half\ncountries play cricket on this planet.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">Hey how about this man\nSudarshan ?</span></div>\n</div>\n</div>\n<br />\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"http://1.bp.blogspot.com/-uLAC33nnGOU/UgKdvpASKGI/AAAAAAAAlFY/NH22yEFzkn8/s1600/HarvardUniversityProfessorRoyJayGlaUBER+.jpg\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" height=\"267\" src=\"https://1.bp.blogspot.com/-uLAC33nnGOU/UgKdvpASKGI/AAAAAAAAlFY/NH22yEFzkn8/s400/HarvardUniversityProfessorRoyJayGlaUBER+.jpg\" width=\"400\" /></a></div>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"color: red;\"><b>Roy J. Glauber, a Jewish\nphysics professor </b></span>at Harvard University (<span style=\"color: red;\"><b> above </b></span>) was honored for his theory that\ndescribes the behavior of light with quantum mechanics, laying the foundation\nfor quantum optics.&nbsp;</span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Prof. Sudarshan then\nwrote a paper expressing his ideas and sent a pre-print to Glauber. Then, guess\nwhat? &nbsp;&nbsp;The quintessential Jew Glauber asks &nbsp;Sudarshan to acknowledge him in the paper\nsaying he also got the same results!<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Glauber\u2019s \"work\" , according to the Nobel citation, \u201cserved to\nbring out the distinction between the behavior of thermal light sources,\u201d like\nlight bulbs, and \u201csources such as lasers.\u201d<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n</div>\n</div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\">\n<div style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"font-size: small;\"><br /></span></span>\n</div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><i>Sudarshan was denied\nthe Nobel in 1979 as well. &nbsp;Sudarshan himself\nsaid, \u201cSteven Weinberg, Sheldon Glashow and &nbsp;Abdus Salam ( Pakistani ) &nbsp;built on work I had done as a 26-year-old\nstudent. &nbsp;If you give a prize for a\nbuilding, shouldn\u2019t the fellow who built the first floor be given the prize\nbefore those who built the second floor?\u201d</i><o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Probably this is what happens\nif a Christian re-converts back to Hinduism?<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"font-size: small;\"><br /></span></span>\n</div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The Nobel Peace Prize\nhas become the Nobel Dirty Joke Prize. &nbsp;And\nnot a very funny joke either. &nbsp;Not funny\nat all when in 1973 they gave it to WORLD\u2019S BIGGEST WAR CRIMINAL the Jew Henry Kissinger.\nIn 1978 it was given to a terrorist Jew , the Israeli PM Menachem Begin.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">It is pathetic that a\nman nominated for Nobel Prize 6 times has has not even been elected to the\nJewish controlled U.S. Academy of Science, considering the pioneering\ncontributions that he made in several fields of physics, quantum optics being\nimportant among them.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">If Glauber's work on\nquantum optics deserves the Nobel Prize, the work of Sudarshan is even more\nsignificant. The Jewish monopolized peer reviewed media&nbsp; referred to `Glauber's P representation'\nrather than as Sudarshan's diagonal coherent state representation.&nbsp;&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Physicists called it `Glauber-Sudarshan\nrepresentation'.&nbsp;&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">However, it was\nSudarshan who pointed out the general validity of the representation as against\nGlauber's suggestion of its applicability in special cases.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Any quantum state of\nlight can be expressed as a mixture or an ensemble of coherent states expressed\nin a particular (mathematical) expression called the `diagonal representation'.\n<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Individual coherent\nstates in the representation had appropriate weight functions that could take\nboth positive and negative values.&nbsp; <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">This `diagonal state\nrepresentation',&nbsp; Sudarshan wrote,\nestablished a formal equivalence between classical and quantum descriptions of\nthe all states of the light field, with the weight functions taking the form of\n(positive valued) classical probability distributions for most optical\nprocesses. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">But the representation\nhad general validity in that it also correctly reproduced purely quantum\neffects.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The theory referred to\nas `Glauber's theory' in the report or as `Glauber - Sudarshan' representation\nin scientific papers is really the Sudarshan `diagonal representation', which\nwas, subsequently, adopted by Glauber and renamed as P-Representation<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"font-size: small;\"><br /></span></span>\n</div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The correct formulation\nof the quantum mechanical treatment of optics was carried out by Sudarshan in\nhis paper in 1963 in which he showed that every state can be represented in the\ndiagonal form. This diagonal representation is valid for all fields. This basic\ntheory underlies all optical fields. &nbsp;All\nthe quantum features are brought out in his diagonal representation.<o:p></o:p></span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; line-height: 150%; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"http://1.bp.blogspot.com/-T1fkoho8owc/UgKj83LGpxI/AAAAAAAAlFw/oXSYv_B2BYo/s1600/3e50864cc5e21368bf457ff69c8d9a37.png\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" height=\"211\" src=\"https://1.bp.blogspot.com/-T1fkoho8owc/UgKj83LGpxI/AAAAAAAAlFw/oXSYv_B2BYo/s320/3e50864cc5e21368bf457ff69c8d9a37.png\" width=\"320\" /></a></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Recently two other\nNobel laureates in physics\u2014John L. Hall and Theodor W. H\u00e4nsch\u2014used the work of &nbsp;Sudarshan to employ lasers in measuring the\nspeed of light and determining the quantum structure of matter.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Sudarshan was also the\nfirst to propose the existence of tachyons, particles that travel faster than\nlight. His areas of interest include elementary particle physics, quantum\noptics, quantum information, quantum field theory, gauge field theories,\nclassical mechanics and foundations of physics.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n</div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">In the Physics\nSymposium held in Austin in November 2006, Sudarshan\u2019s seven science quests\nwere identified as: 1. V-A: Universal Theory of Weak Interaction. 2. Symmetry\n3. Spin Statistics 4. Quantum Optical Coherence: Light on Light 5. Quantum Zeno\nEffect Instability and Decay 6. Theory of Tachyons Faster than Light\nPropagation 7. Quantum Mechanics of Open Systems.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The Sudarshan P\nrepresentation is a suggested way of writing down the phase space distribution\nof a quantum system in the phase space formulation of quantum mechanics.&nbsp; The P representation is the quasiprobability\ndistribution in which observables are expressed in normal order.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">In quantum\noptics, this representation, formally equivalent to several other\nrepresentations, is sometimes championed over alternative representations to\ndescribe light in optical phase space, because typical optical observables,\nsuch as the particle number operator, are naturally expressed in normal order.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"color: red;\">He was denied the Nobel\nPrize in <b style=\"background-color: yellow;\">1979</b> which was won by Steven Weinberg, Sheldon Glashow and Abdus Salam.<o:p></o:p></span></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Sudarshan applied\nquantum theory to the electromagnetic field in the 1950s and 1960s to gain a\nmore detailed understanding of photodetection and the statistics of light.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">This led to the\nintroduction of the coherent state as a concept which addressed variations\nbetween laser light, thermal light, exotic squeezed states, etc. as it became\nunderstood that light can not be fully described just referring to the\nelectromagnetic fields describing the waves in the classical picture <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Although the weak\ninteraction used to be described by Fermi's theory, the discovery of parity\nviolation and renormalization theory suggested a new approach was needed. &nbsp;In 1957, Robert Marshak and &nbsp;Sudarshan &nbsp;proposed a V\u2212A (vector minus axial vector or\nleft-handed) Lagrangian for weak interactions. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">In this theory, the\nweak interaction acts only on left-handed particles (and right-handed\nantiparticles). Since the mirror reflection of a left-handed particle is\nright-handed, this explains the maximal violation of parity. Interestingly, the\nV\u2212A theory was developed before the discovery of the Z boson, so it did not\ninclude the right-handed fields that enter in the neutral current interaction.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The quantum Zeno effect\nis a name coined by George Sudarshan &nbsp;of\nthe University of Texas in 1977 in their analysis of the situation in which an\nunstable particle, if observed continuously, will never decay. One can\n\"freeze\" the evolution of the system by measuring it frequently\nenough in its (known) initial state. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The meaning of the term\nhas since expanded, leading to a more technical definition in which time\nevolution can be suppressed not only by measurement: the quantum Zeno effect is\nthe suppression of unitary time evolution caused by quantum decoherence in\nquantum systems provided by a variety of sources: measurement, interactions\nwith the environment, stochastic fields, and so on.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The mid 1950s were a\ntime of ferment and confusion in particle physics. &nbsp;Marshak and Sudarshan, &nbsp;were able to complete and submit their\nground-breaking paper, \u201cThe Naure of The Four-Fermion Interaction,\u201d of which\nSudarshan (then a mere graduate student) was the first-named author. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Their daring hypothesis\nwas accompanied by a list of four experimental results that, they wrote,\n\u201ccannot be reconciled with this hypothesis\u2026 All of these experiments should be\nredone\u2026 If any of the four experiments stand, it will be necessary to abandon\nthe hypothesis.\u201d&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">This is theoretical physics at its zenith! . The experiments\nwere redone with results that now confirmed their hypothesis. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">It was a stunning\naccomplishment, yet one which has never been recognized with a prize. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Sheldon Glashow,\nfurther adds, \u201cIn my view, Sudarshan\u2019s seminal contribution to weak-interaction\ntheory, representing only a small portion of his total contribution, would\nitself justify the award of a major prize in Physics.\u201d<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">As Rodger M Walser\nsays, \u201c Sudarshan\u2019s and Bob Marshak\u2019s formulation of the V-A theory for the\nweak nuclear interactions was erroneously assigned to Richard Feynman and\nMurray Gell-Mann\u201d, even though the entire scientific community knew that ECG\nwas the first contributor!&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">It really did not matter what Feynman felt, and\nalways stated, that Sudarshan should have also shared the Nobel prize.</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">&nbsp;Marshak acknowledged the originality of Sudarshan\u2019s\n&nbsp;contribution during the 60th birthday\ncelebrations of ECG at Univeristy of Texas at Austin:<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">&nbsp;<b><span style=\"color: blue;\">\u201c . . Sudarshan\u2019s thesis problem turned out to\nbe so exciting that his professor entered as part-time participant. &nbsp;This was easy to do because Sudarshan &nbsp;was brought up in the Indian tradition which\ninstils great respect on the part of the student towards his teacher as a\nrevered <span style=\"background-color: yellow;\">GURU </span>. . . .\u201d </span></b><o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">With regard to the V -\nA Theory, Sudarshan has not got the due credit as it is generally referred to\nas the Feynman-Gell-Mann V-A Theory in physics literature.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">This, as is\ngenerally acknowledged, is mainly because of the bizzare sequence of events.&nbsp;&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Feynman and Gell-Mann published their work in\nJanuary 1958, which actually took the idea from a presentation at a conference\nin Padua by Sudarshan and Marshak in July 1957, as a paper in a prominent\njournal.&nbsp;&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">A short paper by Sudarshan and\nMarshak appeared only March 1958 and the conference proceedings itself appeared\nonly in May 1958. Of course, Feynman has graciously acknowledged this in his\nfamous remark in 1974: \"We have a conventional theory of weak interactions\ninvented by Marshak and Sudarshan, published by Feynman and Gell-Mann and\ncompleted by Cabibbo. I call it the conventional theory of weak interaction,\nthe one that is described by the V - A Theory.\"<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n</div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: large; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-size: large;\">The 1979 prize was awarded to <b><span style=\"color: red;\">Jew</span></b> Sheldon Glashow, Abdus\nSalam ( <span style=\"color: red;\"><b>Ahmeddiya sect hence hated by Muslims </b></span>) and <span style=\"color: red;\"><b>Jew</b></span> Steven Weinberg for the\nelectroweak interaction unification theory. </span>&nbsp;</div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\nHowever, E. C. George Sudarshan and Robert\nMarshak were the first proponents of the successful V-A (vector minus axial\nvector, or left-handed) theory for weak interactions in 1957.&nbsp;<o:p></o:p></div>\n<div style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"font-size: small;\"><br /></span></span>\n</div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">It was essentially the\nsame theory as that proposed by Richard Feynman and Murray Gell-Mann in their\n\"mathematical physics\" paper on lthe structure of the weak\ninteraction. &nbsp;Actually, Gell-Mann had\nbeen let in on the Sudarshan/Marshak work on Sudarshan's initiative, but no\nacknowledgment appeared in the later paper\u2014except for an informal allusion. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The reason given was\nthat the originators' work had not been published in a formal or 'reputable\nenough' science journal at the time. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; line-height: 150%;\"><b><span style=\"color: magenta; font-size: large;\">OH YEAH? THE JOURNAL\nMUST BE <span style=\"background-color: yellow;\">JEW CONTROLLED</span> , RIGHT?</span></b><span style=\"font-size: small;\"><o:p></o:p></span></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The theory is popularly\nknown in the west as the Feynman-Gell-Mann theory.&nbsp;<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The V-A theory for weak\ninteractions was, in effect, a new Law of Nature. It was conceived in the face\nof a series of apparently contradictory experimental results.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The V-A theory would\nlater form the foundation for the electroweak interaction theory. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><b><span style=\"color: blue;\">Sudarshan regarded the\nV-A theory as his finest work. </span></b><o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The Sudarshan-Marshak\n(or V-A theory) was assessed, preferably and favorably, as\n\"beautiful\" by J. Robert Oppenheimer, only to be disparaged later on\nas \"less complete\" and \"inelegant\" by John Gribbin a below\naverage British science writer.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">After a thorough study\nof the experimental evidence, Sudarshan boldly proclaimed that four of the key\nexperiments, all performed by well-established experimental groups, were wrong\nand had to be redone.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">His courageous stance\nwas vindicated by the results of repeat experiments which showed that he was\nright. Unfortunately, for bizarre reasons of protocol, he was denied the\nopportunity to present his result at the 1957 Rochester conference on weak\ninteractions.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Sudarshan outlined his\nresults to Murray Gell-Mann who teamed up with Richard Feynman to write a paper\nin the Physical Review the following year which assumed that V-A theory was\nright, immorally leaving out Sudarshan\u2019s name.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">A paper under the\nauthorship of Sudarshan and Marshak appeared in a later issue of the journal\nthe same year. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Both Marshak and\nSudarshan were guilty of complacency, the former for presuming that the report\nhe presented at the Padua-Venice conference in 1957 and the Rochester preprint\nensured priority,&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"color: blue; font-size: large;\">-- &nbsp;while Sudarshan naively assumed that if one made a discovery\nand shared it with peers, recognition was guaranteed. <o:p></o:p></span></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"color: red; font-size: large;\"><b><br /></b></span></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"color: red; font-size: large;\"><b>-- well NOT when you are in the midst of poisonous vipers.</b></span><span style=\"font-size: small;\"><o:p></o:p></span></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The V-A theory was a\nlandmark in the programme of unifying the four fundamental forces of physics,\ngravitation, electromagnetism, the weak nuclear force and the strong nuclear\nforce.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">It was the first\nadvance since the unification of the phenomena of electricity, magnetism and\nlight, as manifestations of the electromagnetic field by James Clerk Maxwell in\nthe 19th century.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">A whole decade after\nthe V-A theory, followed the Salam-Weinberg unified theory of the weak and\nelectromagnetic interactions, which earned its authors the Nobel prize in 1979.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Like other social\ngroups, the community of scientists has its share of vulgar one-upmanship and\ncut-throat competition.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">In business or politics dog eat dog may be accepted practice,\nbut science's self-definition as the disinterested pursuit of truth entails a\nmoral obligation to rise above the mundane..<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">About having been\ndenied the Nobel twice Sudarshan tersely noted</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">&nbsp;</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">\u201cSteven Weinberg, Sheldon Glashow and Abdus\nSalam built on work I had done as a young 26-year-old student\u201d&nbsp;</span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">After all, the electroweak\ninteraction unification theory &nbsp;was based\non Sudarshan\u2019s V-A (vector minus axial vector, or left-handed) theory.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Sudarshan and Robert\nMarshak were the first proponents of the successful V-A theory for weak\ninteractions in 1957 and Sudarshan regards this as his finest work to date.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">In 1957, Robert Marshak\nand George Sudarshan and &nbsp;proposed a V\u2212A\n(vector minus axial vector or left-handed) Lagrangian for weak interactions. In\nthis theory, the weak interaction acts only on left-handed particles (and\nright-handed antiparticles). &nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"http://1.bp.blogspot.com/-FWOow7ADM1E/UgK2OcOcY1I/AAAAAAAAlHg/0FylJ8JWalc/s1600/Weak_decay_diagram.svg.png\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" src=\"https://1.bp.blogspot.com/-FWOow7ADM1E/UgK2OcOcY1I/AAAAAAAAlHg/0FylJ8JWalc/s1600/Weak_decay_diagram.svg.png\" /></a></div>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; HE WAS HONEST TO ADMIT IT .<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 24px;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 24px;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: #f3f3f3; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 24px;\">MY SON INSISTED AND WROTE THE KOREAN BOYs NAME FIRST FOLLOWED BY HIS NAME-- THROUGH COLLEGE RULES REQUIRED THE MASTERs STUDENTS NAME FIRST AND THEN THE UNDERGRADUATE STUDENTs NAME<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 24px;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 24px;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: #f3f3f3; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 24px;\">JEW ALBERT EINSTEIN WAS A MEDIOCRE BRAIN\u2014HE WAS ABSOLUTE DISGRACE IN MATH\u2014EINSTEIN DID NOT HAVE A MATHEMATICAL BRAIN-- HE OUTSOURCED ALL HIS MATH..<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 24px;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 24px;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: #f3f3f3; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 24px;\">ALL HIS AWARD WINNING IDEAS OF EINSTEIN IS STOLEN FROM FROM VEDAS AND SECONDARY ONES -- STOLEN FROM AN INTELLECTUAL PATENT POOL OF WHICH HE WAS CLEVERLY PLACED AS THE GUARDIAN CLERK BY JEW ROTHSCHILD<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 24px;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 24px;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: #f3f3f3; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 24px;\">SRINIVASAN RAMANUJAN THE INDIAN MATH GENIUS --LOST HIS DIARY, IN WHICH HE HAD RECORDED ALL HIS PRICELESS FINDINGS . THE JEW BASTARDS STOLE IT. , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"color: red;\">Dartos fascia</span> is a\nsmooth muscle sheath that underlies the scrotum, the entire penis and the tip\nof the foreskin. It is necessary for proper temperature regulation of the\ngenitals (causing these structures to elongate in the heat and shrink in the\ncold). Approximately half of the Dartos fascia is destroyed by circumcision.<o:p></o:p></span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; Tamas creates Rajas, and Rajas activates/ excites Tamas. Sattva preserves and mediates .<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"background-color: #cccccc; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot;, times, freeserif, serif; font-size: 16px; line-height: 24px;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"background-color: #cccccc; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot;, times, freeserif, serif; font-size: 16px; line-height: 24px;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: white; font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;, serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 24px;\">7000 year old Vedas say that the only constant in the cosmos is change, everything is in a state of flux, nothing is static-- everything is vibratory. This is what guarantees growth and evolution. It is a cosmic spiraling dance of separate opposing forces, which sustains this universe<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"background-color: #cccccc; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot;, times, freeserif, serif; font-size: 16px; line-height: 24px;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"background-color: #cccccc; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot;, times, freeserif, serif; font-size: 16px; line-height: 24px;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: white; font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;, serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 24px;\">One cannot exist without the other and they are dependant . No phenomenon in this universe is completely devoid of its opposite. They consume each other yet support each other.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"background-color: #cccccc; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot;, times, freeserif, serif; font-size: 16px; line-height: 24px;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"background-color: #cccccc; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot;, times, freeserif, serif; font-size: 16px; line-height: 24px;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: white; font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;, serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 24px;\">CONTINUED TO 2-<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"background-color: #cccccc; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot;, times, freeserif, serif; font-size: 16px; line-height: 24px;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"background-color: #cccccc; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot;, times, freeserif, serif; font-size: 16px; line-height: 24px;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: white; font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;, serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 24px;\">CONTINUED FROM 1-<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"background-color: #cccccc; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot;, times, freeserif, serif; font-size: 16px; line-height: 24px;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"background-color: #cccccc; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot;, times, freeserif, serif; font-size: 16px; line-height: 24px;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: white; font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;, serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 24px;\">If the restraining balance or equilibrium is lost by the mediator ( Vishnu ) , the universe will spiral out of control and end.
