, &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<i style=\"font-family: 'Times New Roman', serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">Imam hi nithya meva\nmuktha muthamothamam sthavam,</i></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><i>Padan, smaran broovan\nnaro vishudhimethi santhatham,<o:p></o:p></i></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><i>Hare Gurou\nsubhakthimasu yathi nanyadha gatheem,<o:p></o:p></i></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n</div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><i>Vimohinam hi dehinaam\nsushakarasya chithanam. 14</i><o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><i><br /></i></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"color: blue;\">Whoever reads,\nremembers and says this best stotra as it is said here,gets purified for ever,\nand obtains devotion in the great Guru Shiva. For this devotion, there is no\nother way. Just the mere thought of Lord Shiva indeed removes the delusion. (14)</span><o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;mangal&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;mangal&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">\u092a\u0942\u091c\u093e\u0935\u0938\u093e\u0928\u0938\u092e\u092f\u0947</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">\n</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;mangal&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">\u0926\u0936\u0935\u0915\u094d\u0924\u094d\u0930\u0917\u0940\u0924\u0902</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">\n</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;mangal&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">\u092f\u0903</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;mangal&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">\u0936\u092e\u094d\u092d\u0941\u092a\u0942\u091c\u0928\u092a\u0930\u0902</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">\n</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;mangal&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">\u092a\u0920\u0924\u093f</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">\n</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;mangal&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">\u092a\u094d\u0930\u0926\u094b\u0937\u0947</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">\n</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;mangal&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">\u0964</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;mangal&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">\u0924\u0938\u094d\u092f</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">\n</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;mangal&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">\u0938\u094d\u0925\u093f\u0930\u093e\u0902</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">\n</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;mangal&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">\u0930\u0925\u0917\u091c\u0947\u0928\u094d\u0926\u094d\u0930\u0924\u0941\u0930\u0919\u094d\u0917\u092f\u0941\u0915\u094d\u0924\u093e\u0902</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;mangal&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">\u0932\u0915\u094d\u0937\u094d\u092e\u0940\u0902</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">\n</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;mangal&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">\u0938\u0926\u0948\u0935</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">\n</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;mangal&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">\u0938\u0941\u092e\u0941\u0916\u093f\u0902</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">\n</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;mangal&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">\u092a\u094d\u0930\u0926\u0926\u093e\u0924\u093f</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">\n</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;mangal&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">\u0936\u092e\u094d\u092d\u0941\u0903</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">\n</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;mangal&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">\u0965</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">\n15 </span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;mangal&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">\u0965</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;mangal&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<i style=\"line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">Poojavasana samaye dasa\nvakhra geetham,</span></i></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><i>Ya shambhu poojana\nparam padthi pradhoshe,<o:p></o:p></i></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><i>Thasya sthiraam radha\ngajendra thuranga yuktham,<o:p></o:p></i></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><i>Lakshmeem sadaiva\nsumukheem pradadathi shambu. 15</i><o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><i><br /></i></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"color: blue;\">At the time of prayer\nafter sunset , whoever utters this stotra by Da\u015bavaktra (R\u0101va\u1e47a) after the\nprayer of \u015aambhu \u2014 \u015aambhu gives him stable wealth including chariots, elephants\nand horses, and beautiful face.[15]</span><o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">||</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;mangal&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">\u0938\u093e\u0930\u094d\u0925\u0936\u093f\u0935\u0924\u093e\u0923\u094d\u0921\u0935\u0938\u094d\u0924\u094b\u0924\u094d\u0930\u092e\u094d</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">\n||<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; ||</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;mangal&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">\u0936\u094d\u0930\u0940\u0917\u0923\u0947\u0936\u093e\u092f</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">\n</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;mangal&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">\u0928\u092e\u0903</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">\n||<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n</div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n</div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><i>Ithi Ravana krutham,<o:p></o:p></i></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><i>Shiva thandava stotram,<o:p></o:p></i></span></div>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><i>Sampoornam.</i><o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><i><br /></i></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"color: blue;\">Thus ends the\nShiva-Tandava Stotra written by Ravana.</span><o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"color: blue;\"><br /></span></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">&nbsp;</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">The stotra is in\npanchachAmara Chanda, in which there are 16 varna-s per line, each line begins\nwith a laghu and the laghu and guru varna-s alternate. So there are eight LG\n(laghu-guru) pairs, making up 16 syllables of each line.</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">&nbsp; </span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">The last shloka is in Vasanta-tilakA metre.</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n</div>\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; line-height: 150%; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"http://1.bp.blogspot.com/-uX8nfRFaf2o/UfKuaq66R-I/AAAAAAAAkwE/OHHOSDsouko/s1600/vadakayil+fcol+1.JPG\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" height=\"320\" src=\"https://1.bp.blogspot.com/-uX8nfRFaf2o/UfKuaq66R-I/AAAAAAAAkwE/OHHOSDsouko/s320/vadakayil+fcol+1.JPG\" width=\"210\" /></a></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">CAPT AJIT VADAKAYIL</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">..</span></div>\n<div style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n</div>\n</div>\n</div>\n</div>\n</div>\n</div>\n</div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n</div>\n</div>\n</div>\n", "author": {"id": "14410812789424637654", "displayName": "Capt. HE WAS A VEGAN</span></b><br />\n<b><span style=\"color: red;\"><br />THE FAKE BUDDHA BORN IN 563 BC , WHO SPOKE PALI, DID NOT BELIEVE IN THE SOUL.. HE ATE PIG. HIS LAST MEAL WAS PIG GIBLETS.. ROTHSCHILDs AGENT BR AMBEDKAR PROPAGATED THIS FELLOW.</span></b><br />\n<br />\nhttp://ajitvadakayil.blogspot.com/2013/07/difference-between-buddha-and-mahavira.html<br />\n<br />\ncapt ajit vadakayil<br />\n..</div>\n</div>\n</li>\n</ol>\n<br />\n<br />\n<ol id=\"top-ra\" style=\"background-color: #cccccc; list-style-type: none; padding: 0px;\">\n<li class=\"comment\" id=\"c6052176998052399971\" style=\"border-bottom: 0px; margin: 0px 0px 16px; padding: 0.25em 0px 0px;\"><div class=\"avatar-image-container\" style=\"float: left; font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;, Times, FreeSerif, serif; font-size: 16px; margin: 0.2em 0px 0px; max-height: 36px; overflow: hidden; width: 36px;\">\n<img alt=\"\" src=\"https://4.bp.blogspot.com/-QSnd-Z8F7Kc/XFtPudWdwlI/AAAAAAABfq4/vxrkFOO7Iu8Mf6-OaPgw6FPpRDSmMgLdgCK4BGAYYCw/s35/capt%25252BajitC%25252Bvadakayil.JPG\" style=\"border: 1px solid rgb(238, 238, 238); max-width: 36px;\" /></div>\n<div class=\"comment-block\" style=\"margin-left: 48px; position: relative;\">\n<div class=\"comment-header\" style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;, Times, FreeSerif, serif; font-size: 16px; margin: 0px 0px 8px;\">\n<cite class=\"user\" style=\"font-style: normal; font-weight: bold;\"><a href=\"https://www.blogger.com/profile/14410812789424637654\" rel=\"nofollow\" style=\"color: #888888; text-decoration-line: none;\">Capt. Ajit Vadakayil</a></cite><span class=\"icon user blog-author\" style=\"background-image: url(&quot;data:image/png; background-repeat: no-repeat; display: inline-block; font-weight: bold; height: 18px; margin: 0px 0px -4px 6px; width: 18px;\"></span><span class=\"datetime secondary-text\" style=\"margin-left: 6px;\"><a href=\"https://ajitvadakayil.blogspot.com/2019/02/mistakes-deliberate-or-inadvertant-in_7.html?showComment=1549649979544#c6052176998052399971\" rel=\"nofollow\" style=\"color: #888888; text-decoration-line: none;\">February 8, 2019 at 11:49 PM</a></span></div>\n<div class=\"comment-content\" style=\"margin-bottom: 8px; text-align: justify;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;times&quot; , &quot;freeserif&quot; , serif;\">OUR PURANAS WERE COMPOSED ENTIRELY IN SANSKRIT ( 100% ) AFTER THE MAHABHARATA WAR.. KRISHNA FIND A MENTION.</span><br />\n<br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;times&quot; , &quot;freeserif&quot; , serif;\">18 MAHAPURANAS PURANAS ( SMRITIS ) WERE WRITTEN FOR HINDUS WHO HAS NO ACCESS TO THE VEDAS ( SRUTI ) ..</span><br />\n<br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;times&quot; , &quot;freeserif&quot; , serif;\">SRUTIS ARE DIVINE AND AUTHORLESS IN ORIGIN..&nbsp;</span><br />\n<br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;times&quot; , &quot;freeserif&quot; , serif;\">PURANAS WERE WRITTEN BY A MORTAL NAMED MAHARISHI VYASA 6000 YEARS AGO WHO ALSO WROTE THE MAHABHARATA IMMEDIATELY AFTER THE WAR..</span><br />\n<br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;times&quot; , &quot;freeserif&quot; , serif;\">ALL HINDU GODS ARE COSMIC ALLEGORIES EXCEPT VISHNU AVATARS RAMA/ KRISHNA WHEN PURANAS WERE WRITTEN..</span><br />\n<br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;times&quot; , &quot;freeserif&quot; , serif;\">VEDAS WERE PENNED IN 5000 BC--WHILE PURANAS WERE PENNED IN 4000 BC-- A MILLINIUM LATER..</span><br />\n<br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;times&quot; , &quot;freeserif&quot; , serif;\">THIS MEANS ANY REFERENCE TO THE PURANAS IN VEDAS ARE POISON INJECTED..</span><br />\n<br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;times&quot; , &quot;freeserif&quot; , serif;\">EXAMPLE :</span><br />\n<br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;times&quot; , &quot;freeserif&quot; , serif;\">\"The rk and saman verses, the chandas, the PURANA along with the Yajus formulae, all sprang from the remainder of the sacrificial food, (as also) the gods that resort to heaven. He changed his place and went over to great direction, and Itihasa and Purana, gathas, verses in praise of heroes followed in going over.\"</span><br />\n<br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;times&quot; , &quot;freeserif&quot; , serif;\">\u2014\u2009Atharva Veda XV.6.10-11,</span><br />\n<br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;times&quot; , &quot;freeserif&quot; , serif;\">MAHABHARATA WAS HAPPENED DURING THE LIFETIME OF MAHARISHI VYASA.. THE SARASWATI RIVER DIED IN HIS TIME.. JUST BEFORE THE MAHABHARATA WAS GOT OVER..</span><br />\n<br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;times&quot; , &quot;freeserif&quot; , serif;\">LYING JEWESS Wendy Doniger, dated the Markandeya Purana to 250 AD so as to include Buddha as the ninth avatar of Vishnu..and Linga Purana to 1000 AD , so as to poison inject Rothschilds FAKE and backdates heroes of the FAKE Bhakti movement..</span><br />\n<br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;times&quot; , &quot;freeserif&quot; , serif;\">The Sthala Puranas in TAMIL were created by Rothschild created FAKE Kanchi mutt.</span><br />\n<br />\n<span style=\"color: red; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;times&quot; , &quot;freeserif&quot; , serif; font-size: 16px;\">http://ajitvadakayil.blogspot.com/2013/06/kanchi-mutt-creation-of-white-invader.html</span><br />\n<br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;times&quot; , &quot;freeserif&quot; , serif;\">THE REAL PURANAS DO NOT ADVOCATE BHAKTI-- ONLY SHRADDHA..IN ANY CASE PUURANAS ARE NOT RELIGIOUS TEXTS..</span><br />\n<br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;times&quot; , &quot;freeserif&quot; , serif;\">THE REAL BUDDHA ( WHO BELIEVED IN VEDAS ) HAS NOTHING TO DO WITH MODERN BUDDHISM ( OF BUDDHA BORN IN 563 BC WHO ATE PIG AND DID NOT BELIEVE IN SOUL ) WE SEE TODAY..&nbsp;</span><br />\n<br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;times&quot; , &quot;freeserif&quot; , serif;\">WHEN THE WHITE INVADER CAME TO INDIA THERE WAS NOT ONE SINGLE BUDDHIST IN INDIA..</span></div>\n<div>\n<span style=\"color: blue; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;times&quot; , &quot;freeserif&quot; , serif; font-size: large;\"><br /></span></div>\n<span style=\"color: blue; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;times&quot; , &quot;freeserif&quot; , serif; font-size: large;\">THE REAL BUDDHA WAS ADI BUDDHA BORN TO ANJANA OF FATHER HEMAJIT IN KIKATA, BODHGAYA IN 1900 BC..&nbsp;</span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;times&quot; , &quot;freeserif&quot; , serif;\">HENCE BOTH REAL BUDDHA ( TIBETIAN ) AND THE FAKE BUDDHA ( SINHALA ) CAN NEVER FIND A MENTION IN PURANAS ..</span><br />\n<br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;times&quot; , &quot;freeserif&quot; , serif;\">BUDDHA IS NOT A NAME --IT IS A TITLE MEANING \"LIBERATED ONE \"... ADI-BUDDHA REAL NAME IS SUGATA..HE WAS A MEMBER OF GRII SECT OF ADI-SHANKARACHARYA ..</span><br />\n<br />\n<div>\n<span style=\"color: purple; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;times&quot; , &quot;freeserif&quot; , serif; font-size: large;\">THE FAKE BUDDHA ( BORN IN LUMBINI , KAPILAVASTU, NEPAL ) OF FAKE ASHOKA FAME WAS NOT LIBERATED... HE STRUGGLED FOR SALVATION.. HIS LAST MEAL WAS PIG GIBLET..HIS MOTHER WAS MAYADEVI AND FATHER WAS SHUDDHODANA..</span></div>\n<br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;times&quot; , &quot;freeserif&quot; , serif;\">RAJATHARANGINI WRITTEN IN SANSKRIT DESCRIBES ADI BUDDHA --THE REAL BUDDHA , WHO EXISTED DURING RULE OF THE SHISHUNAG DYNASTY( KRUTTIKA PERIOD ) , WAS A VEGETARIAN AND BELIEVED IN THE SOUL..&nbsp;</span><br />\n<br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;times&quot; , &quot;freeserif&quot; , serif;\">ADI-BUDDHA NEVER PREACHED AGAINST HINDU PRACTICE OF ANIMAL SACRIFICE FOR THE SIMPLE REASON, IT DID NOT EXIST..</span><br />\n<br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;times&quot; , &quot;freeserif&quot; , serif;\">THE REAL MAHAVIRA ( 24TH THIRTHANKARA ) WAS BORN IN 4500 BC..</span><br />\n<br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;times&quot; , &quot;times&quot; , &quot;freeserif&quot; , serif;\">ADI SHANKARACHARYA ( 2000 BC ) DIED A CENTURY BEFORE THE REAL ADI-BUDDA WAS BORN..ANY REFERENCE OF ADI-SHANKARACHARYA TO BUDDHA IS POISON INJECTED..</span><br />\n<br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;times&quot; , &quot;freeserif&quot; , serif;\">VISHNUs NINTH AVATAR IS AYYAPPA BORN IN 3900 BC, 2&nbsp;MILLENNIUMS&nbsp;BEFORE ADI-BUDDHA ( SON OF ANJANA ) WAS BORN..</span><br />\n<br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; So &nbsp;I asked him where he got it from. &nbsp;He said that a few days ago some Jap tourists had\ncome to his house , and given him that.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"http://1.bp.blogspot.com/-w6wV18mivuM/UeWBodqJrxI/AAAAAAAAkV8/T_izYLI8yOs/s1600/AAAAAAbuddha.jpg\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" height=\"512\" src=\"https://1.bp.blogspot.com/-w6wV18mivuM/UeWBodqJrxI/AAAAAAAAkV8/T_izYLI8yOs/s640/AAAAAAbuddha.jpg\" width=\"640\" /></a></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><b><i><span style=\"color: red;\">Above : Buddha statue</span></i></b></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Naturally I asked him,\nwhat tourists object of interest is there in his house. So he replied that he\nis a Buddhist and his great great great grandfather had brought a very ancient marble\nstatue of Buddha from Sri Lanka , which is installed in his home.&nbsp;</span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">So I made it a point to\nto visit his house to have a dekko. &nbsp;And\nthere was this milky marble white statue in all its serenity. <o:p></o:p></span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">I had a closer look\nwith mE beady eyes.<o:p></o:p></span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The small children in\nhis joint family house had sort of been instructed to start praying like hell\nto Buddha, the moment they see a tourist or a visitor. &nbsp;</span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">For there was a instant LOUD\npraying session of\u2014<o:p></o:p></span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">One of the reasons why\nJainism never left Indian shores is because of the restriction to travel except\non foot (without climbing even on a worm) , and strict vegetarianism &nbsp;the Jain religion placed. &nbsp;And can you imagine today there are 65000 Indian\nJains in UK alone.<o:p></o:p></span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Obviously he started\ntelling me how liitle I knew about Buddhism.&nbsp;</span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">I told him, that I will\ntell him identify a Mahavira stature from a Buddha statue, and then if his\nfamily still overdoes the Jap tourist bit to earn moolah , it would amount to deliberate immoral fraud. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">A Buddha statue will\nnever ever be naked , like the statue in his house. &nbsp;A Buddha statue will never ever have a naked\ntorso, leave alone being totally naked.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The Buddha statue will\nalways have a hand raised in mudra sign. The Mahavira statue will have both the palms ( right on left ) &nbsp;in classic Vedic Ardha- Padmasana meditative pose of Lord Shiva.<o:p></o:p></span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" height=\"640\" src=\"https://4.bp.blogspot.com/-3Tf07vPhL7k/UeWIV3wdVYI/AAAAAAAAkW0/-aa_Lqs1VzU/s640/shiva-yoga.jpg\" width=\"480\" /></a></div>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">A Mahavira statue will\nhave Vishnu\u2019s &nbsp;Sri Vatsa mark on the bare\nchest. &nbsp;&nbsp;Buddha\u2019s chest is covered by cloth .<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; line-height: 150%; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"http://3.bp.blogspot.com/-MB9BHcLWBSM/UeWHJ_BHePI/AAAAAAAAkWc/XfigH832DoM/s1600/CCCCCCC.jpg\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" height=\"400\" src=\"https://3.bp.blogspot.com/-MB9BHcLWBSM/UeWHJ_BHePI/AAAAAAAAkWc/XfigH832DoM/s400/CCCCCCC.jpg\" width=\"355\" /></a></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><i><b><span style=\"color: red;\">Above : Mahavira statue.</span></b></i></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The Buddha statue will\nhave a Hindu Tilak on the forehead. &nbsp;Mahavira\u2019s statue will NOT have it as the 24<sup>th</sup>\nthirthankara was an ascetic.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Buddha\u2019s statue will\nhave a tied up hair bun on top of the head.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; line-height: 150%; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"http://4.bp.blogspot.com/-PFI5-1cMQH4/UeWG-qG9lUI/AAAAAAAAkWU/iRrP-yZRCgU/s1600/BBBBBBB+buddha.jpg\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" height=\"640\" src=\"https://4.bp.blogspot.com/-PFI5-1cMQH4/UeWG-qG9lUI/AAAAAAAAkWU/iRrP-yZRCgU/s640/BBBBBBB+buddha.jpg\" width=\"443\" /></a></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><b><i><span style=\"color: blue;\">Above : Buddha statue</span></i></b></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The earlobes of both\nBuddha and Mahavira are elongated, as a reminder that both were wealthy men who\ncould afford to wear heavy golden earrings, &nbsp;before they&nbsp;\nrenounced material things to seek enlightenment.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">There is so much of\nignorance about Buddha that the stupid Western historian &nbsp;thinks that the FAT statue of Ho-Tai the Chinese\nmonk is Buddha.&nbsp;&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Ho-Tai was a Chan monk working\nas a cook in a monastery in Southern China around the 9th century AD, while &nbsp;Buddha was born in 1900 BC. &nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; line-height: 150%; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"http://4.bp.blogspot.com/-V_iDqrYTbzs/UeWHcqeYSfI/AAAAAAAAkWk/62gXR10mqGM/s1600/download.jpgdwqb.jpg\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" height=\"400\" src=\"https://4.bp.blogspot.com/-V_iDqrYTbzs/UeWHcqeYSfI/AAAAAAAAkWk/62gXR10mqGM/s400/download.jpgdwqb.jpg\" width=\"397\" /></a></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Ho-Tai is regarded by many Buddhists as a\nBodhisatva (not a Buddha), but he was elevated to \u201cgood luck\u201d divinity by the\nTaoists\u2014 a sort of Santa Claus for children.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">In fact I have seen\nseveral US Christian TV evangelists making fun of this statue by saying \u201c If\nBuddha cannot control his obesity, how can he take care of you\u201d \u2013 and then they\nwould throw it into the garbage bin, with the holy congregation cheering him on\n. &nbsp;I dare them to do it with an Islamic icon.<o:p></o:p></span><br />\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"color: red; font-size: large;\"><b>The white Christian\ninvader has placed Lord Buddha at 563 BC. Actually Buddha was born much earlier\nin 1900 BC.</b></span><span style=\"font-size: small;\"><o:p></o:p></span></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The white Christian\ninvader has called Lord Mahavira as the founder of Jainism. This is absolutely\nwrong.&nbsp;&nbsp; <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Emperor&nbsp; Rishabha ( Adinath ) , the father of\nChakravatri Bharata is the founder of Jainism in 8190 BC, and is the first\nThirthankara. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Rishabha is mentioned\nin the Hindu text of the Bhagavata Purana , Vaishnava / Shaiva Pura\u0146as, and\nseveral other ancient texts.&nbsp; <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"color: blue; font-size: large;\"><b>The white historian has\nput Mahavira as a contemporary of Buddha at 599 BC. This is wrong .&nbsp; First of all Mahavira was just a\nreformer.&nbsp; He was the 24th Thirtankara\n.&nbsp; Mahavira&nbsp;was born in 4500 BC.&nbsp;&nbsp;</b></span></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Mahavira fasted to death ( salekhana) at\nPavapure (near modern Patna).<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n</div>\n</div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\">\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"color: blue; font-size: large;\"><b>The 10th avatar of\nVishnu, Kalki will have a Srivatsa mark on his chest.</b></span><span style=\"font-size: small;\"><o:p></o:p></span></span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"http://1.bp.blogspot.com/-OVlB43nuz1I/UeYMs-nTVnI/AAAAAAAAkXw/n4HXZ6BskRM/s1600/kalki-battle.jpg\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" height=\"640\" src=\"https://1.bp.blogspot.com/-OVlB43nuz1I/UeYMs-nTVnI/AAAAAAAAkXw/n4HXZ6BskRM/s640/kalki-battle.jpg\" width=\"603\" /></a></div>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Srivatsa is a commonly\nused surname in Hindu names. &nbsp;Lord\nParasurama an avatar of Vishnu was born in this Gotra.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The endless knot of Sri\nVatsa is found on Vishnu\u2019s right side chest. &nbsp;This symbol represents the interweaving of\nchange with time. &nbsp;&nbsp;Srivatsa is one of the 1008 names of Lord &nbsp;Vishnu in the Vishnu Sahasranam.<o:p></o:p></span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"http://4.bp.blogspot.com/-H9tET_S18Mg/UeWY_1CMS4I/AAAAAAAAkXQ/pDuS0xQNG70/s1600/shivasta_by_MagickSquare.jpg\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" height=\"320\" src=\"https://4.bp.blogspot.com/-H9tET_S18Mg/UeWY_1CMS4I/AAAAAAAAkXQ/pDuS0xQNG70/s320/shivasta_by_MagickSquare.jpg\" width=\"320\" /></a></div>\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The Kaustubh Mani was a\npowerful deep blue diamond with a radiance equal to the sun. &nbsp;It was obtained during the churning of the sea\n( Samudra Manthan ) . <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Lord Vishnu wears\nKaustubh Mani &nbsp;in a garland on his chest.\n&nbsp;&nbsp;This\ntone &nbsp;brings invincibility on to its\nwearer . <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The Srivatsa mark on\nLord Vishnu\u2019s right chest is due to this diamond, which caused a design of fine\nyellow hair in an endless knot geometrical form\u2014as per Sree Bhagawatham &nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;(SB 10.13.48)<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">SAHAR VAKSH STHAL\nKAUSTUBHASHRIYAM, NAMAMI VISHNUM SIRASA CHATURBHUJAM ||<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">This hymn talks about\nthe Kaustubha diamond on Vishnu. . &nbsp;Both\nSrivatsa and Kaustubha are generally listed together in the&nbsp;&nbsp; same line, often in the same word even, in\nthe verses of the Bhagavatam.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Bhaktivedanta VedaBase:\n&nbsp;<b>\u015ar\u012bmad Bh\u0101gavatam &nbsp;5.3.3</b><o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<i><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">atha\nha tam \u0101vi\u1e63k\u1e5bta-bhuja-yugala-dvaya\u1e3f hira\u1e47maya\u1e3f puru\u1e63a-vi\u015be\u1e63a\u1e3f\nkapi\u015ba-kau\u015bey\u0101mbara-dharam urasi vilasac-chr\u012bvatsa-lal\u0101ma\u1e3f\ndaravara-vanaruha-vana-m\u0101l\u0101cch\u016bry-am\u1e5bta-ma\u1e47i-gad\u0101dibhir upalak\u1e63ita\u1e3f\nsphu\u1e6da-kira\u1e47a-pravara-muku\u1e6da-ku\u1e47\u1e0dala-ka\u1e6daka-ka\u1e6di-s\u016btra-h\u0101ra-key\u016bra-n\u016bpur\u0101dy-a\u0144ga-bh\u016b\u1e63a\u1e47a-vibh\u016b\u1e63itam\n\u1e5btvik-sadasya-g\u1e5bha-patayo 'dhan\u0101 ivottama-dhanam upalabhya sabahu-m\u0101nam\narha\u1e47en\u0101vanata-\u015b\u012br\u1e63\u0101\u1e47a upatasthu\u1e25<o:p></o:p></span></i></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<i><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></i></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Lord Vi\u1e63\u1e47u appeared\nbefore King N\u0101bhi with four arms. He was very bright, and He appeared to be the\nbest of all personalities. Around the lower portion of His body, He wore a\nyellow silken garment. On His chest was the mark of \u015ar\u012bvatsa, which always\ndisplays beauty. He carried a conchshell, lotus flower, disc and club, and He\nwore a garland of forest flowers and the Kaustubha gem. He was beautifully\ndecorated with a helmet, earrings, bangles, belt, pearl necklace, armlets,\nankle bells and other bodily ornaments bedecked with radiant jewels. Seeing the\nLord present before them, King N\u0101bhi and his priests and associates felt just\nlike poor people who have suddenly attained great riches. They received the\nLord and respectfully bent their heads and offered Him things in worship.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The white Christian historian\nfunded by Rotshchild has always given bull :--&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">QUOTE -- The last Tirthankara\nwas Vardhaman Mahavira who was born near Kundalpur, Bihar, as a prince in\n599BC. He gave up his kingdom and became a monk at the age of 30 and attained\nliberation, moksha, at the age of 72, in 527BC, by abstaining from food and\nwater. He was slightly older contemporary of Gautama Buddha. They both came from\nMagadha area in Bihar, India, although they never met-- &nbsp;UNQUOTE&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Thank god both of them never had a\nconversation with Jesus Christ or Alexander the Great.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">What else can you\nexpect?<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Sir Isaac Newton was\nportrayed as a genius and Nostradamus type character, while this man was actually\na thief.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Punch into Google\nsearch \u2013<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"color: blue; font-size: large;\"><b><br /></b></span></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; Two phrenic nerves originates in the neck and passes down between the lung and heart to reach the diaphragm.<br />\n<br />\ninhalation through the mouth,<br />\nlengthening the neck,<br />\nlengthening the tongue,<br />\nlengthening the spine,<br />\nholding the breath in,<br />\ncompressing the trunk while holding the breath in,<br />\ntensioning nerves and acupuncture meridians,<br />\nbreathing through alternate nostrils,<br />\nholding the breath out, and<br />\nexpanding the chest while holding the breath out.<br />\n<br />\nTHE FIRST RISHI IS VISHWAMITRA .. THE LAST RISHI HAS BEEN HIJCKED AND CONVERTED TO FAKE YAJNAVALKYA BY JEW ROTHSCHILD.<br />\n<br />\nTHE DHARMA CHAKRA HAS 24 SPOKES ( CONVERTED TO ASHOKA CHAKRA BY JEW ROTHSCHILD )..<br />\n<br />\n<span style=\"color: red;\">http://ajitvadakayil.blogspot.com/2017/07/gayatri-mantra-savitr-savitur-saraswati.html</span><br />\n<br />\n\u201cGayatri Chandhas\u201d (meter). This chandhas has 3 padas ( iambic dimeter lines ) and each pada has 8 syllables with a total of 24 syllables-- octosyllabic feet..<br />\n<br />\n\u0950 \u092d\u0942\u0930\u094d\u092d\u0941\u0935\u0903 \u0938\u094d\u0935\u0903 \u0964<br devasyadh\u012bmahi<br />\ndhiyo yo na\u1e25 prachoday\u0101t<br />\n\u2013 Rigveda 3.62.10<br />\n<br />\nTHE 24 SPOKE REPRESENTAIONS HAVE ALSO BEEN CORRUPTED BY THE WHITE INVADER TO INVOLVE MATERIAL NONSENSE LIKE MONEY, SUCCESS , MAINTENANCE, BHAKTI ( REPLACING SHRADDHA ) , SUPPRESSION , PRODUCTION,SWEETNESS, DEFENCE , PENANCE, SERVICE ETC<br />\n<br />\nTHE 24 SPOKES HAS 24 FEMALE DIETIES ( WOMENs EMPOWERMENT ) WHICH IS NONSENSE..<br />\n<br />\nTHE REAL 24 SPOKES OF DHARMA CHAKRA ARE\u2014<br />\nAnur\u0101ga (Love)<br />\nPar\u0101krama (Courage)<br />\nDhairya (Patience)<br />\n\u015a\u0101nti (Peace)<br />\nMah\u0101nubh\u0101vatva (Magnanimity)<br />\nPra\u015bastatva (Goodness)<br />\n\u015aradd\u0101na ( Shraddha )<br />\nAp\u012b\u1e0dana (Gentleness)<br />\nNi\u1e25sa\u1e43ga (Selflessness)<br />\n\u0100tmniyantran\u0101 (Self-Control)<br />\n\u0100tm\u0101havana (Self Sacrifice)<br />\nSatyav\u0101dit\u0101 (Truthfulness)<br />\nDh\u0101rmikatva (Righteousness)<br />\nNy\u0101y\u0101 (Justice)<br />\n\u0100n\u1e5b\u015ba\u1e43sya (Mercy)<br />\nCh\u0101ya (Gracefulness)<br />\nAm\u0101nit\u0101 (Humility)<br />\nPrabhubhakti (Loyalty)<br />\nKaru\u1e47\u0101vedit\u0101 (Sympathy)<br />\n\u0100dhy\u0101tmikaj\u00f1\u0101na (Spiritual Knowledge)<br />\nMahopek\u1e63\u0101 (Forgiveness)<br />\nAkalkat\u0101 (Honesty)<br />\nAn\u0101ditva (Eternity)<br />\nApek\u1e63\u0101 (Hope)<br />\n<br />\nEACH SPOKE ( SEED ) HAS A COLOUR AND SOUND WHICH IS FOUND ONLY IN THE LAND OF BHA-RA-TA.<br />\n<br />\nGayatri consists of 24 Syllables as follows:--<br />\n1st Line: Ta, sa, vi, tu, va, re, ny, ya - 8<br />\n2nd Line: Bha, go, De, va, ya, dhee, ma, hi - 8<br />\n3rd Line: Dhi, yo, yo, nah, ra, cho, da, ya - 8<br />\n__<br />\nTOTAL-- 24<br />\n<br />\nGAYATRI MANTRA ADDRESSES QUASAR ( SAVITUR ) \u2013 THE PRIMORDIAL LIGHT , OF BRILLIANCE MORE THAN A TRILLION SUNS .<br />\n<br />\nThe Puranas mention that only 24 rishis since antiquity have mastered the 24 mudras, and thus wielded the whole power of\u2014Gayatri Mantra.<br />\n<br />\n<span style=\"color: red;\">https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=2Cno3I1h9EU<br /><br re-enforce the inner vision of Man<br />\n<br />\nGayatri is Brahmani in the morning, Vaishnavi at noon and Rudrani in the evening.<br />\n<br />\n\"Gayatri Chandasaam aham\": In Bhagawad Gita, Lord Krishna proclaims that He is Gayatri in Veda mantras.<br />\n<br />\nCapt ajit vadakayil<br />\n..</div>\n</div>\n<b style=\"color: red; font-family: 'Times New Roman', serif; line-height: relative;\">\n<div class=\"comment-header\" id=\"bc_0_142M\" kind=\"m\" style=\"font-size: 16px; margin: 0px 0px 8px;\">\n<cite class=\"user blog-author\" style=\"font-style: normal; font-weight: Ajit Vadakayil</a></cite><span class=\"icon user blog-author\" style=\"background-image: url(&quot;data:image/png; background-repeat: no-repeat; display: inline-block; font-weight: bold; height: 18px; margin: 0px 0px -4px 6px; width: 18px;\"></span><span class=\"datetime secondary-text\" style=\"margin-left: 6px;\"><a href=\"https://ajitvadakayil.blogspot.com/2018/09/comments-overflow-for-inoperative-load_5.html?showComment=1536514353438#c4493948469647562661\" rel=\"nofollow\" style=\"color: #888888; text-decoration-line: none;\">September 9, 2018 at 11:02 PM</a></span></div>\n<div class=\"comment-content\" id=\"bc_0_142MC\" style=\"margin-bottom: 8px; text-align: justify;\">\nSOMEBODY CALLED ME AND CRIED--<br />\n<br />\nI AM CONFUSED-- WHY IS KRISHNA CALLING ARJUNA SO MANY NAMES<br />\n<br />\n1) SON OF BHARATA<br />\n2) DESCENDANT OF BHARATA<br />\n3) BEST OF BHARATAS<br />\n4) SCION OF BHARATA<br />\n<br />\nAAKHIR YEH BHARAT KAUN HAI BHAIYYA-- KAUN SA KHET KA BEET ROT HAI YEH IS HE THE SON OF SHAKUNTALA ?<br />\n<br />\nBALLS !<br />\n<br />\nSHAKUNTALA NEVER EXISTED.. KALIDASA WHO CREATED SHAKUNTALA NEVER EXISTED...<br />\n<br />\nKALIDASA WAS CREATED AND BACKDATED BY JEW ROTHSCHILD .. TO HIJACK ANCIENT INDIAN HISTORY.. TO SHOW THAT BIG BAND OF BIBLE IN 4004 BC IS RELEVANT..<br />\n<br />\nWHAT IS THE TRUTH?<br />\n<br />\nBHARATA WAS SON OF EMPEROR RISHABHA WAS WAS BORN IN 8190 BC.. RISHABHA WAS THE SON OF NABHI RAJA..GRANDSON OF AGNIDHARA , GREAT GRANDSON OF PRIYA VARTA ( 8255 BC )<br />\n<br />\nBHARATA + RISHABHA ( BHARATARSHABHA ) RULED THE WHOLE PLANET...<br />\n<br />\nRISHABHA NAMED HIS SON BHARATA AFTER THE LAND OF BHARATA<br />\n<br />\nBHARATA THE LAND MASS IS DERIVED FROM THE SHABDHA BRAHMAN TERM ( BHAVA + RAGA + TALA ) BHA + RA + TA !!<br />\n<br />\nIN BHAGAWAD GITA KRISHNA CALLS ARJUNA BHARATARSHABHA --AND THIS HAS BEEN TRANSLATELY WRONLY BY EVER BODY AS -- O BULL AMONG BHARATAS..<br />\n<br />\nBALLS !<br />\n<br />\nBHARATARSHABHA MEANS FIRST NAME BHARAT + SURNAME RISHABHA ..<br />\n<br />\nPOOR JAINS DONT EVEN KNOW THEIR OWN HISTORY..<br />\n<br />\nIF I DONT REVEAL THIS--IT WILL NEVER BE REVEALED TILL THE SUN GOES SUPERNOVA..<br />\n<br />\nAND I HAVE HALF A MIND NOT TO REVEAL IT AS JAINS HAVE BEEN TRAITORS TO BHARATAMATA..<br />\n<br />\nTHE RICHEST JAINS ARE CRYPTO JEWS WHO RUN THE DIAMOND MAFIA IN ANTWERP AND DUBAI-- WHO HAVE BUILD AKSHARDHAM TEMPLES FOR GHANSHYAM PANDE..<br />\n<br />\nBUDDHIRM DIED IN INDIA BUT IT FLOURISHED ABROAD..<br />\n<br />\nJAINISM NEVER WENT ABROAD..<br />\n<br />\n<b><span style=\"color: blue;\">VARDHAMANA MAHAVIRA IS JUST THE 24TH THIRTHANKARA<br /><br />THE FIRST THIRTHANKARA IS ACTUALLY BAHUBALI SON OF RISHBHA , SON OF SUNANDA, BROTHER OF SUNDARI-- AND HALF BROTHER OF BHARATA..</span></b><br />\n<br />\nHOW WAS JAINISM BORN?</div>\n<div>\n<span style=\"color: purple; font-size: large;\">The white historian has put Mahavira as a contemporary of Buddha at 599 BC. This is wrong . First of all Mahavira was just a reformer. He was the 24th Thirtankara . And he was born in 4500 BC.</span><span style=\"color: purple; font-size: large;\">&nbsp;</span></div>\n<br />\n<div>\n<span style=\"color: red;\"><span style=\"font-size: large;\">IN REALITY BAHUBALI IS THE FIRST THIRTHANKARA..</span><span style=\"font-size: large;\">&nbsp;</span></span></div>\n<br />\nMY REVELATIONS NOW JUMP TO&nbsp;<b><span style=\"color: red;\">59.23 %..</span></b><br />\n<br />\n<b><span style=\"color: purple;\">BUT BAHUBALI BECAME A MONK AND HIS USELESS SON SOMAKRITI HAD NO CHILDREN\u2026<br /><br />THIS WHY JAINS CHOSE HIS FATHER THE GREAT EMPEROR RISHABHA AS THE FIRST THIRTHANKARA ( OPPORTUNISM AT ITS BEST )<br /><br />THERE WAS A SCHISM IN THE ROYAL BLOODLINE\u2014AS MAHUBALI AND HIS HALF BROTHER HAD A FIGHT..</span></b><br />\n<br />\n<div>\n<span style=\"color: red; font-size: large;\">Bharata was chosen by Emperor Rishabha to be his successor as he was loved by all and was level headed. Bahubali was an expert in Ayurveda and spent most of his time in Kerala learning Kalari ..</span></div>\n<br />\nAfter conquering the whole Bharata sent a communication to his brothers to accept his order. After an initial hesitation 98 brothers accepted Bharata\u2019s order.. .<br />\n<br />\nNow Bahubali ( son of Sunanda ) was left. When the messenger came to him with message he said \u2013 \u201cO messenger! Go and tell your emperor Bharat that Bahubali isn\u2019t like his brothers who became Sadhus leaving the kingdom.<br />\n<br />\nCONTINUED TO 2--</div>\n<b style=\"color: red; font-family: 'Times New Roman', serif; Army of both sides fought hard. Sometimes army of Bharat dominated army of Bahubali and sometimes vice versa.&nbsp;</span><br />\n<br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;times&quot; , &quot;freeserif&quot; , serif;\">Seeing mass destruction in war it was decided that there should be a single combat between Bharat and Bahubali . One who wins will be the only Chakravarti or \"Emperor of Emperors\".</span><br />\n<br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;times&quot; , &quot;freeserif&quot; , serif;\">In all the stages of battle Bharat had to face terrible defeat at the hands of his younger brother Bahubali in all these fights.&nbsp;</span><br />\n<br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;times&quot; , &quot;freeserif&quot; , serif;\">When a point came that Bahubali must give a lethal strike on his elder half brother Bharata, he raised his hand . He felt that his own sister Sundari and step sister Brahmi ( of script Brahmi Lipi fame ) were on the side of Bharata.&nbsp;</span><br />\n<br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;times&quot; , &quot;freeserif&quot; , serif;\">Instead of giving the final fatal blow, he suddenly uprooted a large tuft of hair from his own head instead, thus declaring himself as a monk, stunning all .</span><br />\n<br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;times&quot; , &quot;freeserif&quot; , serif;\">After ruling for several years Bharata also became a wandering saint, like his father and brother..</span></div>\n<div style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;, Times, FreeSerif, serif;\">\n<span style=\"color: blue; font-size: large;\">Bahubali spent many years in meditation and severe penance. He was unable to become a Jivan Mukt as his enemity with Bharata scorched his soul..</span><span style=\"color: blue; font-size: large;\">&nbsp;</span></div>\n<span style=\"color: blue; font-size: large;\"></span><br />\n<div>\n<span style=\"color: blue; font-size: large;\"><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;times&quot; , &quot;freeserif&quot; , serif;\"><br /></span></span></div>\n<span style=\"color: blue; font-size: large;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;times&quot; , &quot;freeserif&quot; , serif;\">But one fine day Bharata came to him ,( standing naked and doing tapasya totally entangled in creepers )and worshipped him\u2014and his ego left him and he attained instant moksha ..</span></span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; HE WAS TUTORED BY JEW JAMES PRINCEP , A RIGHT HAND MAN OF JEW ROTHSCHILD.</span></b><br />\n<br />\nUSING BRAHMI SCRIPT HE PLANTED ROCK EDICTS AND RELICS ALL OVER INDIA..<br />\n<br />\n<b><span style=\"color: blue;\">EMPEROR ASHOKA WHO CONVERTED FROM BAAAAAD HINDUISM TO GOOOOOD BUDDHISM NEVER EXISTED..&nbsp; &nbsp;THE WHOLE IDEA WAS TO GIVE HINDU DALITS WHO CONVERT TO BUDDHISM ( UNDER BR AMBEDKAR ) AN ICON..</span></b><br />\n<br />\n<span style=\"color: red; font-size: 16px;\">http://ajitvadakayil.blogspot.com/2014/08/chanakya-taxila-university-professor.html</span><br />\n<br />\nTHE TRAVEL ACCOUNTS OF BUDDHIST TRAVELERS FA HIEN AND HSUAN TSANG WERE COOKED UP BY ALEXANDER CUNNINGHAM. FOR THIS lying EFFORT HE WAS KNIGHTED.<br />\n<br />\nHe published \u201cThe Ancient Geography of India\u201d in 1871, which was the first collection of the edicts of the 3rd-Century-BC Indian emperor Ashoka, and \u201cThe Stupa of Bharhut\u201d in 1879-- all kosher LIES ..</div>\n<div style=\"font-size: 16px;\">\n<b><span style=\"color: magenta;\">ALEXANDER CUNNINGHAM GAVE AWAY TAXILA AND NALANDA UNIVERSITIES TO BUDDHISTS... THESE UNIVERSITIES EXISTED THOUSANDS OF YEARS BEFORE BUDDHA WAS BORN..</span></b></div>\n<br />\n4700 YEARS AGO , KERALA MATHEMATICIAN ARYAN BHATTATHIRIPPAD ( ARYABHATTA ) WAS A VISITING MATH / ASTRONOMY PROFESSOR FROM KODUNGALLUR UNIVERSITY, AT MUZIRIS OWNED BY THE CALICUT KING ( MY HOMETOWN ) TO NALANDA UNIVERISTY ..<br />\n<br />\n<span style=\"color: red; font-size: 16px;\">http://ajitvadakayil.blogspot.com/2011/01/isaac-newton-calculus-thief-capt-ajit.html</span><br />\n<br />\nALL OVER THE PLANET WHITE JEWS HAVE REPLACED AYYAPPA WITH BUDDHA AS THE NINTH AVATAR OF VISHNU...BUDDHISM WAS REVIVED TO MAKE THE HINDU SELF LOATHING...<br />\n<br />\n<b style=\"font-size: 16px;\"><span style=\"color: red;\">WE IN INDIA NEVER HEARD OE EMPEROR ASHOKA BEFORE THE WHITE INVADER CAME TO INDIA..</span></b><br />\n<br />\nIN THE MOST ANCIENT VISHNU TEMPLES-- ALEXANDER CUNNINGHAM EMPLOYED SCULPTORS TO CHIP AWAY AYYAPPA AND INSERT BUDDHA.. BUDDHA WAS A MERE MORTAL WHO STRUGGLED FOR SALVATION...<br />\n<br />\nThis is a passage from my social studies book while at school<br />\n<br />\nQUOTE : The great Buddhist Stupa of Amaravati, the Maha chaitya, is one of the greatest architectural achievement of ancient India. The monument was situated on the outskirts of the town of Amaravati near the ancient ruined city of Dharanikota. It was founded in the 3rd-2nd centuries BC during Ashoka Maurya' reign UNQUOTE<br />\n<br />\n<div style=\"font-size: 16px;\">\n<b><span style=\"color: blue;\">THE STUPA NEVER EXISTED AT THE SPOT IN AMARAVATI \u2013IT WAS JUST A FIGMENT OF ROTHSCHILDs SLIMY IMAGINATION.. ALL DIAGRAMS ARE FAKE..</span></b></div>\n<div>\n<span style=\"color: blue; font-weight: 700;\"><br /></span></div>\n<span style=\"color: blue; font-size: 16px; font-weight: bold;\">I HAVE SEEN THE AMARAVATI BUDDHIST RELICS IN THE BRITISH MUSEUM\u2014 THEY ARE ALL FAKE\u2014JUST LIKE THE ASHOKA ROCK EDICTS .</span><br />\n<span style=\"color: red; font-size: 16px;\">http://ajitvadakayil.blogspot.in/2010/12/british-museum-house-of-stolen.html</span><br />\n<br />\nI have seen the Colin Mackenzie album of maps, plans and drawings of sculpture from the stupa at Amaravati at the British Library\u2014all FAKE...<br />\n<br />\nBlind as a bat , SIR Walter Elliot when he was in Madras was assigned with the task of reviving and propagating Buddhism which was dead in India...<br />\n<br />\nHe wrote a false report about the DELIBERATE famine ( created by collector CP Brown ) in Guntur district in 1833 which drove desperate starving entire Telugu families abroad as indentured labour ..<br />\n<br />\nRothschild planned two years in advance as in 1834 Black slavery was abolished and replaced by Indian Indentured labour...<br />\n<br />\nBoth Vemana and Basava are creations of CP Brown , the agent of Jew Rothschild\u2014who created the BURIAL Lingayath religion and backdated it..<br />\n<br />\n<span style=\"color: red; Sorry, Indians are NOT stupid to create a ridiculous language like Pali.</div>\n<div class=\"comment-content\" id=\"bc_0_2MC\" style=\"margin-bottom: 8px; text-align: justify;\">\n<br />\nChilders baby created the first Pali -English dictionary..He was an expert in Hebrew. He went to Sri Lanka to spread Pali among Buddhists there, giving financial incentives.<br />\n<br />\nChilders baby wrote that The Pali Canon (Tripitaka) means the \"Three Baskets.\" The Three Baskets were first written during the reign of King Ashoka around 250 BCE.<br />\n<br />\n<span style=\"color: blue; font-size: large;\">But HEY Ashoka never existed.&nbsp;</span><br />\n<br />\n<span style=\"color: red; font-size: 16px;\">http://ajitvadakayil.blogspot.com/2014/08/chanakya-taxila-university-professor.html</span><br />\n<br />\nChilders BASTARD lied that canons of Buddhist literature are based upon first century CE Sanskrit translations of the Pali canon, which are called the \"Tripitaka\" in Sanskrit.<br />\n<br />\nSo now Sanskrit is a LANGOT of Pali \u2013TEE HEEEEE .<br />\n<br />\nGerman JEW Max Muller used JEW Michael Viggo Fausb\u00f6ll a Professor of Sanskrit in Copehnagen to give BULL about Pali . Max Muller would translate Fausboll babys version of the Dhammapada into English. (M\u00fcller in Vol. 10 of the Sacred Books of the East)..<br />\n<br />\nThe Dhammapada ( way of DHARMA ) is a collection of sayings of the Buddha in verse form, most of it injected with perfume to make Buddhism a great religion. Dhammapada was gleaned out of Khuddaka Nikaya . This nikaya consists of fifteen (Thailand), seventeen (Sri Lanka), or eighteen books (Burma) in different editions on various topics attributed to the Buddha\u2014all injected with perfume.<br />\n<br />\nMax Muller used JEW Thomas Rhys Davids , a Rothschild employee in Sri Lanka, to found the Pali text society. Rhys Davids wrote that Britons had a natural, \"racial\" affinity with Buddhist doctrine. (1) <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">I am not the mind,\nintellect, thought, ego, or some form of the supreme being; I neither have\nears, nor tongue and I neither have nose (nostrils) nor eyes; I am not the sky,\nearth, light or the wind; I am the fortunate, joyful, supreme being who is the\nvery emblem of truth, knowledge and eternal bliss. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">I am consciousness and\nbliss. I am Shiva, I am Shiva.&nbsp; <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><i>Na cha prana sangno na\nvai pancha vayuhu<o:p></o:p></i></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><i>Na va sapta dhatur na\nva pancha koshaha<o:p></o:p></i></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><i>Na vak pani padau na\nchopastha payoo<o:p></o:p></i></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><i>Chidananda rupah\nshivoham shivoham</i> .(2).<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">I am not the most\nessential air that everyone breathes. Nor a part of essential five gases\nrelated to bodily functions (which are Prana, Aparna, Vyana, Udana and Samana).\nI am not the seven-fold material (Rasa, Rakta, Mamsa, Medas, Asthi,Majja and\nShukra) that help in body\u2019s physical development, I am not part of five\ncoverings that help to build up the personality (food, air, mind, knowledge or\nwisdom and pleasure). Nor am I the five organs of action (which are\nspeech/mouth, hands, feet, reproductive and rectum), I am the fortunate,\njoyful, supreme being who is the very emblem of truth, knowledge and eternal\nbliss.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">I am consciousness and\nbliss. I am Shiva, I am Shiva.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><i><br /></i></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><i>Mado naiva me naiva\nmatsarya bhavah<o:p></o:p></i></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">I have no likes or\ndislikes; Not I have any greed or delusion; I have no pride or arrogant vanity;\nNor am I jealous of anyone or in competition with anyone ; I do not need the\nfour main necessities of life (which are Dharma (Law of Life), Artha (Wealth),\nKama (Desires) and Moksha (Liberation); I am the fortunate, joyful,supreme\nbeing who is the very emblem of truth, knowledge and eternal bliss.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">I am not attached to\nany righteousness or sin; I have neither pleasure nor sorrow; I have no need\nfor any Mantra; I have no need for pilgrimages ; I have no need for any sacred\nscriptures; nor do I perform any sacrifise or rituals; I am neither the meal\nnor the one who consumes or what is consumed;<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">I am the fortunate,\njoyful,supreme being who is the very emblem of truth, knowledge and eternal\nbliss.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">I am consciousness and\nbliss. I am Shiva, I am Shiva.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><i>Na me mrutyu shanka na\nme jati bhedah<o:p></o:p></i></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><i>Pita naiva me naiva\nmata na janma<o:p></o:p></i></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><i>Na bandhur na mitram\ngurur naiva shishyah<o:p></o:p></i></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><i>Chidananda rupah\nshivoham shivoham </i>.(5).<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">I have no fear of\ndeath, nor do I have caste distinctions; I neither have a father nor mother\nbecause I was never born; I have neither kin/relatives nor friends; I have no\ngurus and nor am I a disciple; I am the fortunate, joyful, supreme being who is\nthe very emblem of truth, knowledge and eternal bliss.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">I am consciousness and\nbliss. I am Shiva, I am Shiva.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><i>Aham nirvikalpo\nnirakara rupo<o:p></o:p></i></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><i>Vibhur vyapya sarvatra\nsarvendriyanam<o:p></o:p></i></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><i>Sada me samatvam na\nmuktir na bandhah<o:p></o:p></i></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><i>Chidananda rupah\nshivoham shivoham </i>.(6).<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">&nbsp;&nbsp; <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: 'Times New Roman', serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">I am free of thoughts\nand beyond imagination since I have no form; I am all pervading and exist\neverywhere; I am the king of all sense-organs; I am always impartial to\neverything and everyone,; I am free from everything and I have no attachment to\nanything; I am the fortunate, joyful, supreme being who is the very emblem of\ntruth, knowledge and eternal bliss.</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: 'Times New Roman', serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">I am consciousness and\nbliss. I am Shiva, I am Shiva.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n</div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"http://4.bp.blogspot.com/-1eFP_17eb0w/UeRcZE7TySI/AAAAAAAAkVU/GwrtL4Zmkws/s1600/vadakayil+fcol+1.JPG\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" src=\"http://4.bp.blogspot.com/-1eFP_17eb0w/UeRcZE7TySI/AAAAAAAAkVU/GwrtL4Zmkws/s200/vadakayil+fcol+1.JPG\" height=\"200\" width=\"131\" /></a></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">CAPT AJIT VADAKAYIL</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">..</span></div>\n</div>\n", "author": {"id": "14410812789424637654", "displayName": "Capt.
